member.summary: Uses the URL of a portal to locate portal information.
member.param: The url to review. Be sure to exclude protocol headers (i.e., use customername.customer,com without the http:// or https://)
member.returns: The portal information for associated URL.
member.remarks: This method is useful in a situation where you don't necessarily know the association that is usingthe portal - for instance, if you're writing generic code intended to be used by more than one instance of a MemberSuite. MemberSuite assigns each customer a unique URL for thier portal; furthermore, customers have the ability to indicate a "custom" portal URL. Based on this information, you can read the incoming HTTP request information to determine the URL being referenced, and then pass the URL to this funciton. If you don't have the URL, but have the portal ID, then use

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Concierge.IConciergeAPIService.Login(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs in a user with the username and password.
member.param:
The ID of the association that the user should be logged into. If no ID is specified, then the logic is as follows:
If the is set, then that association is used for login
If the user is a , then the first association for that customer will be used as the login destination
If none of the above are true, then no association set set for the logged in user, and any functions that require a logged in association will not work until an association is chosed.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be run for console users - if you are attempting to login a , then refer to .

member.summary: Records an error that has occurred in your system with a full audit log
member.remarks: This method differs from in that you have the opportunity to persist a full . Because audit logs are not persistable by default, you must use this method to write one to the database. Also - the audit log you specify here must be of type .

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Concierge.IConciergeAPIService.RecordJobProgress(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{MemberSuite.SDK.Types.JobStatus})
member.summary: Allows you to record the progress of a .
member.param: The ID of the job you would like to update
The additional log text to append to thelog
The new status to assign to the job, if applicable

remarks.p: Because the is persistable, you are free to create and save them. However, you may find instances in which a job log is extremely long - say, when processing 10,000 records - and loading the record, appending a line, and saving it throug the UI will prove to be inefficient. This method circumvents this process by using an optimized database write that eliminates the need to load the job from the system.

Additionally, you can change the status at the same time you are recording progress. The keeps you from having to load the entire job, plus the log, from the database simple to flip the status to . This is optional and usually done only when the job is complete, or when the job encounters an error.

member.remarks: This method will only act on preferences listed in the parameters; submitting an empty list will do nothing. member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Concierge.IConciergeAPIService.Get360Packet(MemberSuite.SDK.Searching.Search,System.Collections.Generic.List{MemberSuite.SDK.Searching.Search})
member.summary: Executes a search for a 360 screen.
member.remarks:
This method is used by the MemberSuite UI to execute a parallel search set for the 360 screen. The
is the main record being looked for, and the
are the related queries. The API will attempt to execute these queries in parallel for better performance than executing them in serial. Additionally, the
returned will have information that will aid in creating a 360 screen of your own, including whether any relevent relationship types exist, or any custom objects tied to the target type should be displayed.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Concierge.IConciergeAPIService.GetObjectBySearch(MemberSuite.SDK.Searching.Search,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from the database by search.
member.param: The field to use as object identifier.

remarks.p:
Very often, you'll need to return an object not by it's ID, but by an arbitrary search criteria. Use this method when you need to get a single object back from the database based on a criteria. Use
when you need to retrieve multiple objects.

Note that you can achieve the same result by running with the OBJECT() parameter. For example: select OBJECT() from Individual where Email='operations@membersuite.com'
The above code would pull the first object with the specified email address.

You may not always want to use the ID field as the basis for getting the object. For instance, in the example above, you might want to pull the primary organization. Use the
to indicate what field the API should use to pull the object. For instance, specifiying PrimaryOrganization as the
would return an Organization, not the Individual. By default, the system will assume you want to use ID, if you don't specify a parameter.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Concierge.IConciergeAPIService.GetObjectsBySearch(MemberSuite.SDK.Searching.Search,System.String,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets multiple objects from the database by search.
member.param: The field to use as object identifier.
The maximum number of records to return.

remarks.p:
Very often, you'll need to return objects not by their ID, but by an arbitrary search criteria. Use this method when you need to get objects back from the database based on a criteria. Use
when you need to retrieve a single object.

Note that you can achieve the same result by running with the OBJECTS() parameter. For example:
select OBJECTS() from Individual where Email='operations@membersuite.com'
The above code would pull the all objects with the specified email address.

You may not always want to use the ID field as the basis for getting the object. For instance, in the example above, you might want to pull the primary organization. Use the to indicate what field the API should use to pull the object. For instance, specifying PrimaryOrganization as the
would return an Organization, not the Individual. By default, the system will assume you want to use ID, if you don't specify a parameter.

member.summary: Describes a compiled search, including any references fields that are cross-object.
member.remarks:
Once a search is created, it may contain cross-object fields. For example, this output column will return the primary organizations name on an invoice:
BillTo.PrimaryOrganization.Name
When running , you'll only get the fields defined for that search. Because there's an infinite combination of cross-object search possibilities, you'll want to call this method when describing a specific search, as opposed to the base search.

member.summary: Adjusts the entitlement quantity for an entity/entititlement type.
member.remarks: This method will find the first available entitlement, and adjust the quantity. Use a negative value to adjust it downward. If it cannot find an entitlement or a specified context/type, it will create one with the adjusted value.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Concierge.IConciergeAPIService.ListEntitlements(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets all of the entitlements for an entity
member.param: (Optional) the type of entitlement you'e looking for. If null, then all entitlements are returned.
member.remarks: This method will properly "collapse" entitlements and return one record for each entitlement type/context. In other words, if you have two job posting entitlements, the system will only return one record, with the combined quantity/quantity available. That's why you want to call this method, rather than just running a search.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.GetCertificateByStoreAndSubject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a X509 Certificate from the Local Machine certificate store using the given store and subject. This method attempts to match on the certificate subject which is less unique than thumbprint but does not require settings to be reconfigured if the certificate is regenerated.
member.param: The subject of the certificate to retrieve (usually starts with CN=)

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.VerifySignature(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.PublicKey)
member.summary: Attempts to use the supplied public key to verify the supplied digital signature against the supplied data. Will attempt to use RSA using SHA1 first then will attempt DSA.
member.param: The data to use to verify the signature
The PublicKey to use to verify the data.
member.returns: True if the supplied signature was generated using the private key pair of the supplied public key against the supplied data. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.VerifySignature(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Attempts to use the supplied certificate to verify the supplied digital signature against the supplied data. Will verify with the public key always as it should have been signed with the private key.
member.param: The data to use to verify the signature
The certificate containing the PublicKey to use to verify the data.
member.returns: True if the supplied signature was generated using the private key pair of the supplied public key against the supplied data. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.VerifySignature(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm)
member.summary: Attempts to use the supplied public key to verify the supplied digital signature against the supplied data. Will attempt to use RSA using SHA1 first then will attempt DSA.
member.param: The data to use to verify the signature
The PublicKey to use to verify the data.
member.returns: True if the supplied signature was generated using the private key pair of the supplied public key against the supplied data. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.VerifySignature(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.RSACryptoServiceProvider)
member.summary: Attempts to use the supplied public key to verify the supplied digital signature against the supplied data. Will attempt to use RSA using SHA1 first then will attempt DSA.
member.param: The data to use to verify the signature
The signer to use to verify the data.
member.returns: True if the supplied signature was generated using the private key pair of the supplied public key against the supplied data. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.GenerateProcessSymmetric
member.summary: Generates and encrypts a random symmetric key and IV that are valid for the life of the process. Generally there is no need to call this method because values are randomly generated on first use. However this method can be used to generate a new key and IV pair during the life of the process. **WARNING** executing this method will render all data encrypted using the process symmetric key unretrievable.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.EncryptDataWithProcessSymmetric(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts the supplied data using the Rijndael algorythm and a random key/IV that only exists during the lifespan of the executing process. **WARNING** restarting the executing process or calling GenerateProcessSymmetric() will render all data encrypted using the method unretrievable.

member.name: M:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.DecryptDataWithProcessSymmetric(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts data previous encrypted using the Rijndael algorythm and the random key/IV generated during the lifespan of the executing process using the EncryptDataWithProcessSymmetric method. If the executing process has been restarted or GenerateProcessSymmetric() has been called since the data was encrypted this method will fail.
member.param: The data previously encrypted using EncryptDataWithProcessSymmetric

member.name: F:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.EncryptedProcessSymmetricKey
member.summary: The encrypted Rijndael key to use during the life of the executing process for process scoped encryption. This should always be stored in a SecureString or other encrypted type to minimize the time the clear-text key exists in memory.

member.name: F:MemberSuite.SDK.Utilities.CryptoManager.EncryptedProcessSymmetricIV
member.summary: The encrypted Rijndael Initialization Vector (IV) to use during the life of the executing process for process scoped encryption. This should always be stored in a SecureString or other encrypted type to minimize the time the clear-text IV exists in memory.
